title: GitLab.com Database Incident - The rm -rf Horror Story
what_happened: A tired engineer accidentally ran 'rm -rf' on the wrong database server during a stressful incident, deleting 300GB of production data. The command was meant for a test server but was executed on the primary database instead.
impact: 6 hours of user data lost (issues, merge requests, comments)
Affected thousands of users and projects worldwide
Exposed backup system failures (5 out of 5 backup methods failed)

timeline.event: Engineer attempts to remove directory on wrong server
Realizes mistake - hits Ctrl+C but too late
Discovers all 5 backup methods have issues
Service restored with 6 hours of data loss

lesson: Even experienced engineers make mistakes under stress. This is why MairuCLI exists - to catch these mistakes BEFORE they happen. Always double-check which server you're on, and always verify the path before running destructive commands.
halloween_twist: This is a real horror story, not a Halloween tale. The engineer's 'oh no' moment when they realized what they'd done is the stuff of nightmares. Don't let this be your story!
